required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: EMERALD - AssEssment of CoMorbidities & Atrial ArRhythmiA Burden in DuaL-Chamber PaceD Patients
clinical_study.official_title: AssEssment of CoMorbidities & Atrial ArRhythmiA Burden in DuaL-Chamber PaceD Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the incidence and evolution over-time of co-morbidities in a general dual-chamber pacemaker population (n=2188 patients) through a 2 years follow-up.

detailed_description.textblock:
The study will focus on the number of patients moving to persistent Atrial Fibrillation as a function of cumulative %Vp (< or >40%), in a general dual-chamber pacemaker population through a 2 year follow-up (n=2188).
The same endpoint will be analyzed in sub populations (Sinus Node Disease and AVB) at 4 years follow up (n=4290).

primary_outcome.description: Two consecutive visits in which atrial fibrillation was present or - at least 22 hours of atrial fibrillation for at least 7 consecutive days or - at least 22 hours of atrial fibrillation per day for fewer than 7 consecutive days if an interruption by electrical or pharmacologic cardioversion occurred
as measured in the device over the timeframe period

study_pop.textblock: The sponsor plans the enrolment of a total of 2188 subjects in this clinical investigation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient implanted (primo-implant, replacement, upgrade) with dual chamber pacemaker from less than two months or implanted at inclusion.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindicated for cardiac pacing, according to the ESC and ACC/AHA/HRS guidelines
- Permanent or persistent atrial tachyarrhythmia

clinical_study.keyword: Evaluate the incidence and evolution over-time of co-morbidities
